I designed the test similar to SmokeTest that does even more stuff... I still think, it makes sense to test simple "copy" and an "aggregation". I also want to make the test more complex and add a repartitioning step for one of the aggregates -- but it did not work yet, so I just removed the repartitioning...

Maybe we should split this into individual test though. WDYT?
I guess it becomes a trade off between system test runtime and code complexity. My preference would be to have simple tests that are easy to follow. If time becomes a problem then merge them.

LGTM! Thanks @vahidhashemian I think in the future when we remove the deprecated old consumer in console consumer we should consider removing those direct configs like `from-beginning`, `key/value-deserializer` along with the old consumer related configs like zookeeper, so that the precedence could be simpler as two layers: cmd line property first, config file second.

Test PASSed (JDK 7 and Scala 2.11).
There are some checkstyle failures.
Merging to trunk and 0.11.0.

@vahidhashemian The problem lies in 

```
val convertedBytes = deserializer.map(_.deserialize(null, nonNullBytes).toString.
        getBytes(StandardCharsets.UTF_8)).getOrElse(nonNullBytes)
```

Note that we call `toString` if a deserializer is specified and hence used to deserialize the bytes to objects; before this patch if nothing is specified the `deserializer == None` and hence this code path would not be called, with this patch it is called and `toString` prints the byte array's address.

I think the root cause is that console consumer is actually assuming the underlying bytes are `String` typed, and hence when no deserializers are specified it just "happen" to print it as Strings. More formally we should use `StringDeserializer` instead of `ByteArrayDeserializer` as the default deserializer, and then inside `DefaultMessageFormatter` the key / value deserializers would not need to be an `Option[Deserializer]` anymore as we will always set it, and we can also reduce the above code path as

```
val convertedBytes = deserializer.deserialize(null, nonNullBytes).toString.getBytes(StandardCharsets.UTF_8)
```
